data.prayer: Father, you desire the people in the state of Harari People who are far from you to hear about you.
data.verse: "Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand."

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Harari People, Ethiopia
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, make yourself known to the 183,400 people living in Harari People through the internet today.
data.verse: They have no speech, they use no words; no sound is heard from them. Yet their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world. In the heavens God has pitched a tent for the sun.

data.prayer: Father, it’s possible most of the 76,371 lost people in  Harari People, Ethiopia have never held or opened a Bible. Please change this, Father.
data.verse: Yet faith comes from listening to this Good News—the Good News about Christ.

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict the believers in Harari People, Ethiopia to not assume the ministry is for professional clergy, but for all who have been called by you.
Spirit, I pray that the Oromo, Jima people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Father, let love abound more and more in the church of Harari People, Ethiopia.
data.verse: And this is my prayer: that your love may abound more and more in knowledge and depth of insight

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Harari People, Ethiopia. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Spirit, guide the 32,955 believers in the state of Harari People into all truth as they interpret Scriptures.
data.verse: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow;

location.name: Harari People
location.people_groups_list: Oromo, Hararghe, Harari, Gujarati, Somali, K'abeena
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Oromo, Hararghe (7,036,000), Harari (51,000), Gujarati (3,400), Somali (7,280,000), K'abeena (86,000)
